quotes: President of Germany from 2004 to 2010.
elected to his first five-year term by the Federal Convention on 23 May 2004
was subsequently inaugurated on 1 July 2004.
reelected to a second term on 23 May 2009.
Just a year later, on 31 May 2010, he resigned from his office
He was president of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development from 1998 to 2000
head of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) from 2000 to 2004.
From 2012 to 2013, Köhler served on the UN Secretary-General's High-level Panel on the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
Horst Köhler's parents, ethnic Germans and Romanian citizens, had to leave their home in Bessarabia in 1940
they were resettled in 1942 at Skierbieszów
As the Wehrmacht was pushed back and the first parts of Poland had to be abandoned in 1944
In 1953, they left the Soviet Zone – via West Berlin – to escape from the communist regime.
